conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes processes A→B, B→C, and C→A, returning to state A. Temperature at A is 200K.
The image shows a p/V diagram with processes A→B (vertical), B→C (horizontal), and C→A (vertical).
At state A, pressure is 4 Pa and volume is 1 L.
Apply ideal gas law: \( pV = nRT \). At A, \( p_A V_A = nRT_A \).
Calculate work done A→B: \( W_{A \rightarrow B} = 4 \times 1 - 4 \times 2 = -4 \) J.
Calculate temperature at B: \( T_B = \frac{4 \times 2}{1.5 \times 200} = 0.533 \) K.
Work done B→C is isothermal: \( W_{B \rightarrow C} = 0 \).
Work done C→A: \( W_{C \rightarrow A} = -W_{A \rightarrow B} = 4 \) J.
Calculate temperature at C: \( T_C = \frac{p_C V_C}{RT_A} = 0.533 \) K.
